TopicTitle: To the mun without any debris left in space.

Articles.Content:
This challenge is relatively simple if you know what your doing, Your objective? To go to the mun without ANY debris left in space by the time your capsule does the final touchdown to kerbin.

Rules: Must supply Proof, Such as screenshots.

No Debug Menu or Hyper Edit

There's exceptions for mechjeb since it isn't really much of a cheat.

Also please show a screenshot of the map, Showing no debris

Prize: Bragging rights for one, Seccondly you can have the challenge wraith medal ribbon thing.

So yeah, get out there and get working haha!
Do Mun debris count? I mean, leaving spare tanks on the Mun. Or does crashing the transfer stage into the Mun count?

Do Mun debris count? I mean, leaving spare tanks on the Mun. Or does crashing the transfer stage into the Mun count?

As long as the debris is gone or on a surface your good.
I think i already saw people have designed SSTO planes that can do this without problems, your rules do not forbid refuelling wich makes it even easier.

Just did a test run of my Object 23 which is aplicable here:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I really donkeyed my flying of this thing there. I got it into space with at least 3 km/s left, but somehow I managed to get it to the MÃƒÂ¼n and back with only a very small amount of fuel left. But despite that, it worked like a charm.

thats fairly easy even in a staged rocket, you only need a single LVN attached to a single FL-t800 get from a sub orbit of kerbin onto the mun, then ditch the FL-t800 and LV-n on touchdown and return to kerbin in your lander

This is really an easy challenge so I thought I'll do it in style. So this is not an SSTO, rather a "classical" big mission where I just take care no piece of debris escapes. Sorry, I forgot to take map shot showing no debris. But take my word there was indeed no debris left. Even when staging the lifter I was still on suborbital trajectory, for all the rest there are screenshot proofs.

It's nice to see something tempted you Kasuha, as you were saying you'd done all you wanted/could (and your Eve-landing-twice in one launch is a masterpiece).

Nice, It's going to be hard to choose from rodyle to kasuha, Who both did exactly what the challenge stated with no cheats...

I'm going to go with Kasuha, And rodyle gets props for also doing great

Nice jobs Gratz to our winner kasuha!

with only half of the was it 4th or 3rd tech level unlocked....
